title: Jay Foulston
text:
Jay K. Edward Foulston (born 27 November 2000) is a Welsh professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> defender who plays for <a href="Taunton%20Town%20F.C.">Taunton Town</a>
Career.
Foulston was a product of the Newport County academy and was promoted to the first team squad in July 2017 following appearances in Newport's pre-season friendly matches.
He made his senior debut for Newport County aged 16 in the <a href="EFL%20Cup">Football League Cup</a> first round match versus <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> on 8 August 2017 as a late second-half substitute. Newport won the game 2–0. His debut aged 16 years and 255 days made him the third youngest ever County player behind <a href="Regan%20Poole">Regan Poole</a> and <a href="Steve%20Aizlewood">Steve Aizlewood</a>
On 16 April 2018, he signed his first professional contract at Newport until June 2020. On 10 January 2019, he joined <a href="Merthyr%20Town%20F.C.">Merthyr Town</a> on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season. On 11 July 2019, he joined <a href="Chippenham%20Town%20FC">Chippenham Town</a> on loan until the end of the 2019-20 season. He was released by Newport County at the end of the 2019–20 season.
International.
In March 2018, Foulston was called up to the <a href="Wales%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">Wales under 19 squad</a> for two friendly international matches against Croatia.
